intro: Caryophyllata potentilloides, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with numerous small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Caryophyllata potentilloides is adapted to harsh environments and is commonly used in ecological restoration projects.
